intro: Pentacalia loretensis, commonly known as the Loretto pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in mountainous regions. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
